message.content:
To extract a three character code like "1Jn" from a filename in format "57-1Jn.usfm", you can use the following regular expression:

```python
import re

filename = "57-1Jn.usfm"
code_pattern = r"[A-Za-z0-9]{3}"  # Match three characters (letters or digits)
code_match = re.search(code_pattern, filename)  # Search for the code in the filename

if code_match:
    code = code_match.group()  # Extract the matched code from the search result
    print("Three-character code:", code)
```

In this example, `r"[A-Za-z0-9]{3}"` is a regular expression pattern that matches exactly three characters, which can be either upper or lower case letters (`[A-Za-z]`) or digits (`0-9`). The `re.search()` function searches for the first occurrence of this pattern in the filename and stores it in the `code_match` variable. Finally, we print out the extracted code.

Please note that if the filename does not match the specified format or does not contain a valid three-character code, the regular expression will not find any matches and the `code_match` variable will be `None`.
